content.question: A spherical conductor of radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is given a charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mstyle></math>. What is the electric potential inside the spherical conductor at half of its radius and why?

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator 4 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>, because half the radius contains an eighth of the charge.
